name: Guild Wars 2
description: This game requires an SSD hard drive as 3D models are lazy loaded constantly.
notes: To improve perfomance, these settings. are suggested. Based on this thread.
content:
files:
- client: https://s3.amazonaws.com/gw2cdn/client/branches/Gw2Setup-64.exe
game:
  arch: win64
  exe: drive_c/Program Files/Guild Wars 2/GW2-64.exe
  prefix: $GAMEDIR
installer:
- task:
    arch: win64
    description: Creating win64 prefix
    name: create_prefix
    prefix: $GAMEDIR
- execute:
    command: mkdir -p "$GAMEDIR/drive_c/Program Files/Guild Wars 2"
- move:
    dst: $GAMEDIR/drive_c/Program Files/Guild Wars 2/GW2-64.exe
    src: client
system:
  disable_compositor: 'true'
  env:
    DXVK_HUD: 0
    DXVK_LOG_LEVEL: none
    LD_PRELOAD: libpthread.so.0 libGL.so.1
    STAGING_SHARED_MEMORY: 1
    WINEARCH: wine64
    WINEDEBUG: -all
    __GL_DEFAULT_LOG_ANISO: 0
    __GL_FSAA_MODE: 0
    __GL_SHADER_DISK_CACHE_PATH: $GAMEDIR
    __GL_SHADER_DISK_CACHE_SKIP_CLEANUP: 1
    __GL_SYNC_TO_VBLANK: 0
    __GL_THREADED_OPTIMIZATIONS: 1
    __GL_YIELD: NOTHING
    __NV_PRIME_RENDER_OFFLOAD: 1
wine:
  UseGLSL: disabled
  dxvk: true
  esync: true
  overrides:
    d3d10: native
    d3d10_1: native
    d3d10core: native
    d3d11: native
    d3d9: native
    dxgi: native
    nvapi: disabled
    nvapi64: disabled
